text: Lagos Lagoon is a lagoon in Nigeria. It is named after the city of Lagos, Nigeria. The city is on the southwestern side of the lagoon. ==Description== The lagoon is more than long. It is wide. It is separated from the Atlantic Ocean by a long sand spit wide. The sand spit has swampy margins on the lagoon side. The lagoon's surface area is about .Lagos Lagoon Coastal Profile: Information Database For Planning Theory, by Obafemi McArthur Okusipe, Department of Urban and Regional Planning, University of Lagos - Accessed September 22, 2008 It is fairly shallow. Ocean-going ships don't go through it. Smaller barges and boats do. ==References== Category:Bodies of water of Nigeria Category:Lagoons
title: Lagos Lagoon
